cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly drifting north-northwest, forecast to turn northwest and make landfall on the South Carolina coast during Saturday, then accelerate northeastward up the U.S. East Coast and move offshore of New England by late Tuesday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina coast between Charleston and Myrtle Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from South Carolina through New England, including Massachusetts shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Only a 4% cumulative chance of sustained 34-kt winds; brief gusts to tropical-storm force are unlikely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Boston; surge threat confined to the Carolinas.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain possible late Monday into Tuesday, generally 1â€“2 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and elevated surf/rip-current risk along the Massachusetts Bay approaches may hamper vessel movements.
